Rule: Higher education levels (Assoc, Prof-school, Doctorate, Masters) are associated with a higher likelihood of earning more than $50K.
Being married or in some cases separated/widowed is associated with a higher likelihood of earning more than $50K.
Occupation types such as White-Collar or even Blue-Collar in government jobs can influence earning predictions.
Employment in the private sector or government jobs can influence earning predictions.
Maintaining a consistent work week (e.g., 40 hours per week) is associated with positive income predictions.
Gender being Male is associated with a higher income.
Certain changes in occupation, even within the same workclass, can lead to a higher income.
Marital status being Married or Divorced leads to higher income compared to being Single.
